Package ws.rocket.path.builder

A builder-based solution for creating trees.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    TreeNodeBuilderAware
    Contract for TreeNode values that wish to participate in its node initialization when the builder pattern is used.
    TreeNodeCallback
    Callback contract for TreeNodeBuilder to control key and value object initialization of tree nodes.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    TreeNodeBuilder
    A builder version for creating TreeNodes.

Package ws.rocket.path.builder Description

A builder-based solution for creating trees. Instead of creating each tree node individually, the builder approach simplifies construction by allowing tree nodes be conveniently described and delegating the actual construction to the builder. A simple example of usage would be following: 
 TreeNode root = new TreeNodeBuilder("root", "root value")
  .addChild("child1", "child1 value")
  .addChild("child2", "child2 value")
  .addChild("child3", "child3 value")
  .build();

Key And Value Callback

Sometimes the key and value objects need to be applied a common initialization process (e.g. dependency injection). For this purpose, an implementation of TreeNodeCallback can be provided to the TreeNodeBuilder constructor. Each key and value object provided to the TreeNodeBuilder.addChild(Object, Object) method will go through the callback before passed to TreeNode constructor.

Delegation of Subtree Creation

Since declaring a huge tree in one Java file can introduce a lot of class imports and can make the tree creator look guilty of knowing too much about other classes, the builder-approach helps to delegate some tree construction work to tree node value objects. Every node value implementing TreeNodeBuilderAware is given an instance of TreeNodeBuilder for the TreeNode instance where the value object is placed so that it could further describe the child nodes of its tree node. Using this approach, tree node values have an option to describe the child-nodes of their tree nodes and delegate the description of further descendants to the values of child-nodes. It should reduce the problem of how much classes know about other classes in an application.
